claims.claim: The United States incarcerates a disproportionate number of African Americans.
claims.quote: America locks up more than 50% of their African American population.

claims.claim: Incarcerated individuals are subjected to labor that is inadequately compensated.
claims.quote: America is built on the idea of slavery, free labor when they're in prison, free labor. What they make? Some people, some of them, [...] they get like maybe $2 a day or something like that.

claims.claim: Children of incarcerated parents suffer financial consequences in the welfare system.
claims.quote: And if you got a lot of the parents that are in there and their children are in the foster care system or on the welfare system, that money has to be paid back.

claims.claim: Returning citizens face significant financial burdens including child support and restitution.
claims.quote: So when they come out, if they come out, you got child support, you owe, you got restitution, you owe, you need to get a place, you need to get a car. How do you survive?

claims.claim: Restrictions on returning to previous neighborhoods limit options for returning citizens.
claims.quote: And you're not supposed to go back into your old neighborhood. . So where do you go?

claims.claim: There is a need for widespread public education about the challenges facing returning citizens.
claims.quote: So there, there's a lot of education that needs to happen to the general public.
